critique: This document pertains to the withdrawal of public lands for the construction of a dam in the Columbia River. It was issued in 1934 under the Federal Emergency Administration of Public Works. Given the context of the Great Depression and the New Deal, this action reflects government intervention in the economy to create jobs and infrastructure. There is no information related to immigration, civil liberties, or social inclusion. The document centralizes control over land use at the federal level. The withdrawal of land could be seen as an expansion of executive power, although it is based on existing legislation.
